name: Pibidi Ltd
tag_list: events, business, startup, social-network, internet, website, calendar, planning, booking, planner, organizer, meetings
overview:
Pibidi (www.pibidi.com) takes the hassle out of planning and organising your social and business engagements.

Pibidi launched late last year in BETA form.

Pibidi is the brainchild of three young friends and entrepreneurs, Richard Myerson, Alistair Ridley and Joshua Tyler, who identified a need for an online tool that could simplify the process of planning and organising your day to day life.

The name Pibidi is an acronym which stands for Plan it. Book it. Do it.

The concept behind Pibidi is to enable you to arrange any sort of plan or event, easily and for free. Users can either put plans on their public planners to keep relevant people in the know, or their private planners which keep plans completely private, but still lets contacts know you are busy at that time. Pibidi lets you know 24/7 what your contacts are up to and when they’re free, so you can join in and make plans within a few clicks, and even book a range of services from restaurants to shows and concerts.

Pibidi features include:

The Planner - A free tool enabling you to make, share, and view each otherâ€Ÿs past, present and future plans online. You can make a plan with anyone online that has a pibidi planner.

The reminders â€“ Pibidi allows users to send out timed reminders for themselves, and for others as well.

The News Feeds - Delivering news about what your contacts have planned in the future. This way you always know what everyoneâ€Ÿs doing, ahead of time.

Events - A mix of upcoming user-generated and commercially bookable events tailored to your interests.

Business Services (phase 2) - Local businesses in your area that provide services that can be booked for free.
